findings.title: Dynamic SQL
findings.description: The candlestick/ticker lambdas accept the CandleStickResolverEvent structure and use its members to dynamically create an SQL query to the Timeseries DB (PostgreSQL under the hood). This can be used to trigger SQL injections.

findings.title: Improper use of BLS encryption library routines
findings.description: The audit report recommends following guidelines from the BLST library and IETF recommendations, implementing checks for public keys in affine coordinates, proof of possession checks, unit tests for malicious participants, and investigating risks of splitting zero attacks.

findings.title: Engine main and proxy account withdrawal confusion
findings.description: It is possible to execute certain 'engine' service withdrawal functions for the main account from the arbitrary (not linked) proxy account.

findings.title: Ambiguous return value in the authorization routine
findings.description: The authorization lambda routine returns an ambiguous value (Access::ReadOnly, false), prohibiting access but not giving ReadOnly access.

findings.title: Cancel order function signature verification relies only on the order id
findings.description: The engine does not verify the canceled order signature at all, relying solely on the orderId for cancellation, which can lead to the possibility of canceling that order for an attacker if the orderId is being signed in any other use case.

findings.title: Cloudformation template is not synced with the code
findings.description: The cloudformation template for DynamoDB is not synced with the code, specifically the 'cc' field present in the lambda/chainnotifier/src/dynamodb_client.rs but absent in the cloud/cloudformation.yaml.

findings.title: Confusing mathematical operations
findings.description: The system supports some confusing mathematical operations with orders, including negative prices and quantities.

findings.title: Dependency on the order of validators
findings.description: The OCEX::submit_snapshot function adds a signature on a newly submitted snapshot if the validator has a different index in the [OCEX]::Authorities storage vector, allowing a malicious validator to collect more signatures.

findings.title: Inconsistent configuration for AppSync endpoint authorization between the lambda and cognito user pool authorizers.
findings.description: Duplication of functionality in AppSync endpoint authorization between lambda and Cognito user pool authorizers which can mislead developers and become a source of authorization errors.

findings.title: Insufficient documentation and unit testing for the peer role control
findings.description: The Orderbook client gossip logic relies on the underlying substrate code to check if the connected peer is FullNode or Validator, without properly documenting and testing this security control.

findings.title: Null pointer dereference
findings.description: This issue is informational and serves as a reminder to properly handle null values. Service crashes drastically affect its performance and provide a bad image about the application quality, thus reducing general trust in it.

findings.title: Place order does not verify the link between the proxy and main accounts
findings.description: The place order function does not verify the link between the main and proxy accounts, allowing an attacker to generate account keys and put the OrderPayload::user field value to his public key.

findings.title: Strings usage instead of objects
findings.description: This issue is informational and serves as a reminder to use structures and objects to pass complex data types instead of strings, providing more maintainable code, type validation, and preventing tricky errors.

findings.title: The lack of email validation in the register user action.
findings.description: The lack of input validation could lead to different errors, including dangerous ones like injections, scripting and request forgery.

findings.title: The lack of limits to user registration
findings.description: There are no limits to the number of addresses that a user can register, which could lead to different errors including injections, scripting and request forgery.

findings.title: Undocumented behavior for set_snaphost_nonce
findings.description: The set_snapshot function in the OCEX pallet lacks proper documentation and unit testing of consequences.
